sen.e: In the Nihonshoki, his name was written as 狭穂彦王(Sahohiko no miko), while in the Kojiki, it was written as 沙本毘古王(Sahohiko no miko).

sen.j: 日下部連・甲斐国造の祖。
sen.e: He was the ancestor of Kusakabe no muraji (one of the most privileged surname given to local lords during the Yamato Dynasty) and Kainokuni no miyatsuko (local lord of Kai Province).

sen.e: Ogiho no okimi, the ancestor of Kazuno no wake and Chikatsuomi no kano no wake, and Murobiko no miko, the ancestor of Wakasa no mimi no wake, were his maternal half brothers, and Empress of Emperor Suinin, Sahohime no mikoto was his maternal half sister.

sen.j: 垂仁天皇5年に妹の狭穂姫命に天皇暗殺を試みさせるが失敗。
sen.e: In the fifth year of Emperor Suinin's reign, he incited his younger sister Sahohime no mikoto to assassinate the Emperor, who was her husband, however, his attempt was failed.
